TopicTitle: Show off your awesome KSP Pictures

Articles.Content: My return vehicle on it\'s way back from the Mun, got a nice shot of it inbetween the Mun and Kerbin.

My first ever successful rendevous!

The Charon space ferry is here to resupply the StarHab space station.
Screens from a recent shuttle mission to the KSS!
I\'m just waiting to snap a great sun-rise photo on the mun. Still waiting.

Managed to get my first vehicle to orbit the Mun (as opposed to Kerbol....and thanks to an accidental premature separation, those boys won\'t be back....). Not much fuel left so I don\'t know if I can get them home, so these might be memorial photos...

A particularly cool shot I took of one of my space planes on its ascent. Sadly, I deemed it too unwieldly to fly (especially with the wing flapping like a bird, though the bending actually kind of made it look even cooler) and retired it without saving it as a craft.
I don\'t recall ever seeing a Mun landing quite like this one...
This is my First Space Plane(That Went Into Space) Thought It Looked Cool At this Angle
feeling you get when flying by a glider you just launched from you rocket plan. kerbulls say it all
You decoupled a flying wing? Nice.

You decoupled a flying wing? Nice.

thank you, atm i feel like a guy holding his new born child. thats my baby :-[
Lifting off a brand new design from Mun. This was a very enjoyable rocket to fly and to land was cool too. I look forward to doing more like this!

Lifting off a brand new design from Mun. This was a very enjoyable rocket to fly and to land was cool too. I look forward to doing more like this!

That thing looks absolutely epic

1. The terrain on the moon can be awesome.

2. Practiced landing without MechJeb, had a nice view of Minmus in the background.

3. Fuel stack battle fleet in position to invade Kerbin!
This one was okay
I can see the death star in that photo! Run for your lives!!!!! :sos: :sos:

That thing looks absolutely epic

1. The terrain on the moon can be awesome.

2. Practiced landing without MechJeb, had a nice view of Minmus in the background.

3. Fuel stack battle fleet in position to invade Kerbin!

Until I opened that picture, I thought you\'d actually rendezvoused seven rockets at once!

Lifting off a brand new design from Mun. This was a very enjoyable rocket to fly and to land was cool too. I look forward to doing more like this!

Its Looks Like The Vtol Off of Saints Row 3

This one was okay

... that\'s no Moon...

By far my most successful mun landing, using mech-jeb only for it\'s orbital info panel. Took several tries as well, those landing legs fall off with the slightest bit of lateral movement on landing, that\'s what you get for attaching them with blutac and sticky-tape i guess ^^

I\'ve been stalking the forums for a while, so I thought I\'d finally show my face with these two pictures ;D :

This first one was my first munbase in v0.15 (which my friend subsequently destroyed).

This picture is of my space station, which I just launched half an hour ago.

Here\'s a few pics I took.

A mun landing. Nothing too special, but I liked the hill in the background. In fact, I\'ve chosen it as my next landing site

Just yesterday, I launched my first space station into orbit. It doesn\'t do anything, nor have any means of propulsion, SAS or RCS, but it looks really nice and was fun to launch.

Kerbinrise. You can see Kerbin visible underneath the sun.

For whatever reason, my rocket simply fell apart a little bit after starting the flight. Right back to the VAB!

After a takeoff went horribly wrong and my rocket started to flip, I jettisoned part, only to realise the other part and the boosters were still at full throttle, and this ended up in a violent explosion of the first and second stages, and sending the third and the lander flying towards the ground.

OH Harlorf, you crazy.

It\'s that this point the physics likes to tumble it out of control.

I\'m so close as getting my orbital fuel rod in orbit. 18 tanks of fuel in the center on stock parts. Idea for docking later.

^^^

Dem stacks

Finally achieved my first encounter with Minmus today and established a circular orbit at around 10km. Very nice opportunity to take my first 'family photo.'

From left to right: Mun, Kerbin, Minmus, Bill, Jeb, Bob.
Testing MrPwner\'s Mercury Capsule in orbit around Kerbin. It was a good flight. No new problems.
